data.title: Fine place for Sunday Brunch
data.text:
The service was good.  I arrived early and had several cups of coffee and enjoyed the atmosphere before Brunch.  The food was very tasty, well prepared and well presented.  
There is a stage for music, I would like to go to a Mon. night open mic session sometime.
At night they offer a bar.

data.title: Service is just non-existent.
data.text: This is by far the slowest and most dissapointing service in all of frederick.  I really kind of like its beatnik vibe, but if i just want a cup of coffee, it shouldnt take over a half hour to get it.  The servers seem confused and do not cooperate well with each other.  Nice spot, but how long can this last?

data.title: Great food and a great vibe
data.text:
We ate at Cafe Nola with our family, that included grandparents, teenagers, and a younger child.  The wait staff were great!  They were all so friendly and helpful, especially in helping us get seated with a party of 7.  The food was great and there was something for everyone from the older ones that wanted Americana food, to the vegetarians, to the child.  Every dish we had was exceptional.  
There were also lots of interesting alcohol infusions at the bar.  We didn't partake on this visit, but it looks like a wonderful selection to try out.
I would definitely go to Cafe Nola again.  I would love to try it out on a night when they have live music!

data.title: Very good breakfast
data.text: Somewhat pricey but excellent food and huge servings. A very enjoyable breakfast in a small but inviting location in the heart of downtown Frederick. Well worth the short wait.

data.title: Famous place
data.text: I think cafe Nola in Frederick famous place. The atmosphere is good. I would like to go there again.

data.title: Good food and friendly service
data.text: While visiting Frederick, Maryland we found this restaurant in the heart of the historic downtown district. There was a party of four of us and we were seated promptly for lunch. My wife and I ordered their burgers which were huge and juicy with great fries (sweet potato or regular) as a side dish. There were other side options if you were not into potatoes. The other couple ordered two different sandwiches which were equally appetizing. Although the menu prices are a little on the high side ($14 for each of our burgers), the quality and quantity of food tend to make up for the inflated price.  Our server, Leah was extremely personable and helped make our visit even more enjoyable.

data.title: Fantastic Breakfast!
data.text: My wife and I were on our way to West Virginia, and stopped in Frederick for breakfast. I checked out on TripAdvisor the best choices and came up with Cafe Nola. We parked out on East Patrick Street and walked to the restaurant. Camdon seated us and also waited on us. We both started with the medium roast Illy coffee which was delicious. My wife then ordered the Italian Benedict and I ordered the Pick Me Up. Both of our egg dishes were wonderful and we can't wait to return to try some of their fruit infused liquors. Great Place!

data.title: On our way to PGH
data.text:
Just left D.C. and after being stuck in hellacious traffic on the highway we found the historic town of Fredrick, Md. Searching the Internet for a place to eat we found Cafe Nola. It is the kind of place I love. Fresh made foods, great coffee, expressos and pastries.
The inside art was extremely interesting. The current exhibit reminded me of the 1960's artist who drew the Rat Fink comic and were plastic models. Unique.
As to the food, we had breakfast and it was delicious. Md crab benedict, fenominal.
I had delicious french toast with blueberry compote. 
Well worth the stop and will go again in the near future.

data.title: Coffee and WIFI and tasty food
data.text: Cafe Nola is one of the few places in downtown Frederick with coffee and WIFI that stays open late. That fact alone makes me a fan. The dinner is also quite tasty - I had the banh mi sandwich and the vegetarian ravioli over the course of the weekend. My only minor quibble is price to portion size ratio - for $15+ per entree, I would have expected more food. However, the food itself is delicious, as are the coffees and the Bloody Mary. I also appreciate the free ear plugs dispenser outside the front door (it frequently has live bands). I'm sure I'll be back to Cafe Nola if I return to Frederick.

data.title: Pretty good!
data.text: I had the Black Bean Wrap with sweet potato fries.  Besides the black beans this wrap has red cabbage slaw, Chipotle sauce, avacodo and salsa inside a spinach wrap.  The whole meal was pretty good!  Staff was very friendly, it was busy, so our food did take some time to come out to  us.

data.title: Great pit stop off I-70
data.text: Really fresh food...very good! So glad we ventured away from the interstate! Fresh fruit, real tea, no bags!

data.title: Best to get there early for dinner
data.text:
Everytime I visit Frederick I make it a routine to stop for at least one meal at Cafe Nola. Their menu isn't extensive but has something for everybody except the fussy. I would recommend going to Nola with your "FOODIE" buddies, people who appreciate dishes prepared in unique ways using fresh ingredients. I would also advise don't go when you are in a hurry...service is good and efficient but go for the whole experience, share some appetizers and unwind.
A large verity of beers and cocktails are available.  Many locals frequent here so that counts for something.
I understand they have local musical talent that performs some evenings I have not had the pleasure of that experience.

data.title: Humina hominy
data.text: If you have occasion to visit Frederick MD, breakfast or brunch will not be wasted if you visit Cafe Nola. Can't recommend the Shrimp Hominy. It's a work of art. The locally grown white corn is steamed in the husk to make the base of the dish.

data.title: Great food and fun atmosphere
data.text: Stopped by Cafe Nola on a quick visit to Frederick and really enjoyed it! The drinks were good but didn't wow us, big fan of vodka and felt the infusion list was a little lacking, but loved the food! Had the duck with cauliflower and it was awesome, also really enjoyed the bahn mi sandwich and sweet potato fries. Definitely would recommend and will come back next time we're in town!

data.title: Simple and Good
data.text: Had a Friday brunch. Fresh delicious really hot coffee! Yummy bagels, eggs. Convenient downtown location. Has a couple of tables outside, also.

data.title: welcoming folks and relaxed vibe
data.text: Feels like someones large living room. In a good way. Friendly folks, and great spirits menu. A great find to get in from the shopping and heat

data.title: Great coffee and a nice menu
data.text: I enjoy the food, the coffee and the service, but it reminds me of one of these bohemian hipster places in Berkeley or San Francisco (and I'm not really into that). It also gets a bit noisy and their prices are moderate. Overall, a pretty good place to eat, drink and hang out. Their location is a real bonus; the outdoor patio is great for people watching.

data.title: Almost excellent
data.text: We went here for brunch at 11 am on a Thursday and were surprised to find the place very busy. Our food was very good, the only problem was being told that they were out of the first four different things we ordered from the menu. It became comical trying to choose something they actually had, but what we finally got was well prepared.

data.title: An excellent cafe with a full menu
data.text:
The service is very friendly, the menu is thorough and the service is great. I've been here a number of times and never had anything I disliked. The lox board and either a blackberry white mocha or German chocolate mocha are the way to go along with an "everything" bagel. 

I do recommend getting here early. By lunch, the place is packed. Sitting outside on the patio is quite fun for people watching. 

Great place.

data.title: What happened?
data.text: When traveling through the area Nola's was our "go to" spot for fab food, great made from scratch drinks and excellent service. I was very disappointed on our most recent lunch there. First it took and hour to get lunch, yes they were busy, but not that busy. My tuna wrap was $13 and was about half the size of what I expected (and I'm not a big eater). I'm asking myself "what happened"? I don't mind paying higher prices if the food is extraordinary and portion sizes are satisfying. I noticed a lot more interesting choices in Frederick and will probably try a different place next time.
